intro: Parosela tuberculata, commonly known as the roughleaf parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with a rough, hairy texture, and its small white flowers are clustered in umbels. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
